reviewText: The protag is just a terrible person and the game forces you to get involved in drama that could be easily avoided. The production quality, art, and way the novel is presented is actually okay, which makes me even madder that the plot had to be something as bad as what it was. You can finish it in under 2 hours, but I would not recommend playing it at all.

reviewText:
Who needs real life 3D women who will hurt and betray you when you can find comfort in the smile of a gentle 2D virtual love? That was Aoiâ€™s point of view until Sora came into his life. Aozora Meikyuu is a visual novel that tells the story of Aoi and Soraâ€™s meeting and path to romance. This unlikely pair have to figure out how to co-exist as Sora tries to bring out the kinder side of Aoi. A tale of human emotions, sexual desires and personal growth, Aozora Meikyuu will take readers on an interesting journey with lovely artwork to bring everything to life.

Aoi is a normal high school student until his love confession to a classmate goes wrong and he drops out after the rejection. Years later he is now a, hikikomori, shut-in who spends most of his time watching anime and playing video games, especially visual novels. One day on his way home from the store a beautiful young woman with cotton candy-hued hair literally falls from the sky on top of him, naked. The lovely Sora then proceeds to force herself onto Aoiâ€™s life, moving into his home and becoming his housemate. Despite Aoi not wanting to deal with her he canâ€™t help but grow closer and closer to the mysterious girl, the game following their relationship until the shocking end.

I canâ€™t really go much more into detail about the story without spoiling anything, however it did take a bit of an unexpected turn. During most of the game Sora doesnâ€™t talk about herself at all nor does she give much reason for being so attracted to Aoi. He treats her pretty badly for the first half of the game, you can even kick her out of the house and not let her stay but that will end the game prematurely. There is also another girl after his affection, Misaki, however she seems very shoehorned in and itâ€™s also odd that she wants anything to do with the protagonist. Aoi is a shut-in who would rather look at anime girls than real ones, heâ€™s rude and rather depressing. He only becomes more likeable after falling in love with Sora. The second half of the game is mainly about their relationship, sex life and him coming to terms with where his life is at the moment. Misaki, despite being another romantic option, only shows up twice and only has two ending; a good and a bad one. She also has no CG pictures which is a shame.

All of the CG is of Sora, and itâ€™s well done. She is drawn to be very busty and sexy and the artwork ranges from cute to downright sexual. There is no nudity in the game, save for one picture so everything is pretty tame. There are sex scenes in the game but they mainly consist of kissing and then fade to black moments. I donâ€™t mind this but for the amount of times sex does happen it makes the lack of CG for the scenes very apparently. The music is nice, there isnâ€™t a huge amount of variety however. There were a few times where the music seemed to be a bit creepy but nothing of the sort was actually happening which created unnecessary suspense.

Aozora Meikyuu is a simple game, it wonâ€™t take that long to finish one play-through and the other endings are easy to get after that. The story itself has a few dull moments, unfortunately having to do with a lot of the day-to-day interactions between Sora and Aoi. When the plot takes twists and turns, theyâ€™re very interesting and well written but overall the game hoovers in neutral territory with not much happening. However, itâ€™s a good read with lots of choices to make and the choices are a timed which is a nice feature for this genre of game. There is plenty of humor in the game, especially at the irony of it being a visual novel about a shut-in who plays visual novels. The price is very reasonable for the gameâ€™s length and there are also trading cards to collect, if you donâ€™t mind a bit of naughty humor I would recommend this game wholeheartedly.


For more recommendations and reviews on our favorite up and coming quality games follow Lot's O Giveaway's group curations here!

reviewText:
Fair warning. This game can be beaten in under an hour, if not thirty minutes. I only have more playtime on it because I wanted the card drops.

---

I can honestly see no reason to want to play this game when there are much better visual novels on Steam and on the internet in general. This game is shoddily written, which is only made worse by the fact that it's painfully short.

There are actually choices and multiple endings in this game, to which I can give it some credit. However, since everything is so bunched up together due to the game's length, there's no time to feel any impact to your decisions besides oh hey

reviewText:
TL;DR - If this was early access, I would 100% recommend it.

A promising story which isn't long enough to truly deliver. Playing through to several different endings took under an hour.

It has a fairly standard plot (for VNs), a girl falls out of the sky and tries to seduce you. Obviously she isn't a normal girl. The story is so short I can't say more without spoiling it.

If the story was fleshed out more, so it took a few hours for a play through I would most likely recommend it. It also could use achievements and ending tracking. In its current state it is simply too short.

I really liked the inaction" mechanic. A timer started when you were presented a choice
date: and letting the time run out had its own result. In fact sometimes silence was the correct answer.\n\nTo the devs
recommended: please expand on it! I would love to change this to a positive review! I will also keep an eye open for future releases you do."

reviewText:
Product received for free

{EDIT:  DID NOT Receive for FREE - checked box in error - oops sorry}

Aozora Meikyuu is a very short VN, but of good quality, and the price is fair.  In the Discussions, many stated having difficulty getting anything but the violent ending, but that was not my experience, as the story ended peacefully the 1st few times I ran through it.  I was able to achieve the violent ending, but it took making stupendously stupid decisions at the screens where you must choose a path/answer or fail to answer in time.

For the price and quality ...  9/10      With a degree of replayability for the various endings.

reviewText:
My playtime is because of letting it idle while at work for the remaining card drops. Actual playtime is around an hour with a little more to take alternate paths.

I enjoyed this short visual novel. A naked girl falling from the sky was a bid odd, but the ending cleared that up. The rest of the beginning seemed a bit typical, and I started to get annoyed at Aoi and wanted to punch him for being such a weirdo. As the story progressed, I was really intrigued with what was going on. I wanted to know why they both acted the way they did. The ending was a complete surprise. I was both happy and sad for the guy.

I'm not sure if I would've paid $4.99 for it, but I got it as part of the $6 level Anime Angels" bundle on IndieGala. If you want to get this game cheap
recommended: you can still get that bundle in the next 9 days (before June 15
hoursPlayed:
2016). I really recommend giving it a go.

reviewText:
Well... I didn't buy my game, it was more or less like my friend bought it and shared his acc's library with me, so I had one or two of his visual novels which, I'd say are rather enjoyable for romance stories, but this one had a bit too much erotic scenes which I mostly flew through.

So, mainly I'd recommend it, the reasons will be the following ones :

1. The CG's are nice, I really enjoyed the art although the eyes could be drawn better / more lively when they're open, they look fat :P

2. The story's pretty nice, but if you go into a wrong route/selection, you get a bad end, there's like 3 death ends and 1 true end, which you eventually stay immortal with Sora forever in the labyrith that leads to the heavens where only gods can live (you'd get reincarnated).

3. Sora was cute (though I didn't like her being dirty), I enjoyed how she had a ponytail later on, liked those instead of twin tails, if you like a lively, active and a girl that's being honest with you in everyway, yeah go for this game

If you have some extra bucks you can spend and you want a visual novel that's somewhat dirty without hentai scenes, this is your thing.

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/0tUUxxNoMQ8

Take on the role of 'Aoi Takamatsu' a young man who after being upset that he can only be a friend with a girl instead of dating her becomes a shut in only playing 'Gal Games' in his free time while never realising that his parents abandoned him and are not just 'work abroad'.  This visual novel literally drops the love interest 'Sora' into the player's hands to deal with.

Story aside this visual novel has issues with its writing that contains grammatical issues, inconsistency PoV and most importantly using short phrases to represent complete sentences.  More often than not the game will take the conversation in a direction that is divergent than what the phrase would imply leading a frustrating amount of guesswork when making choices.

reviewText: Yo so straight up you're not gonna get a Welcome to the NHK level intense narrative or cliche breaking bonanza from this game. And that's aight. it's a standard male romance fanatsy at a cheap price in which you intially scorn your musume b/c plot until you inevitably bed her. If you've been drinking too much of Hiyao Miyazaki's kool aid and can't handle dem overused tropes then this ain't for you. But this game genuninely struck a cord in my colesterol filled arteries. The romance felt sweet and enjoyable. Sometimes ya need to take a step back from the cynicism and just enjoy the simpler daikimakuras of life. For what it's worth it's a good deal with an ending that was kinda suprising. This game is like a good snack. You're gonna enjoy it, it's quick to finish, but you aint gonna write home to momma bout it. But hey thats alright. If you got some spare cash and wanna nice, quick little romance whynaut neglect dem starving children in africa and pick this up? You might feel just a tiny fraction embiggened emotionally as a result

Well, that was short.

Writing was a bit hit and miss. Protag went from tsun to dere faster than I can count to 20.
